original: D. Product Commitment . Up to Two-thousand (2,000) 4oz bottles of BlackMP Living Water Concentrate to be used as a “value appeal” for annual membership renewal (up to a $220,000 value) allocated to the NFLA and provide a combination/assortment of bottle water to NFLA-NC for display and use though out the term of the Agreement at the NFLA-NC facilities. The Company agrees to pay for all shipping costs of the Products under the Product Commitment to the fulfillment center, currently Sharp Marketing, located in Fort Lauderdale, FL and to any subsequent fulfillment center that is contracted by the NFLA to provide distribution to existing and new NFLA members.
ollama_generated: D. Product Obligation . The Company shall supply a minimum quantity of Two-thousand (2,000) 4oz bottles of BlackMP Living Water Concentrate per year, with an approximate total value of up to $220,000 during the term of the Agreement, for use as incentives for annual membership renewal. The NFLA shall be responsible for the cost and organization of shipping these products from their designated fulfillment center, currently Sharp Marketing, located in Fort Lauderdale, FL, or any subsequent fulfillment center contracted by the NFLA to provide distribution to existing and new NFLA members. The Company will provide the necessary product combination/assortment for display and use at NFLA-NC facilities throughout the Agreement's duration.

original: SECTION SIX. SERVICES OF NFLA-NC A. If Company desires to use the services of the NFLA-NC and/or any of its officers and members as a model in connection with Company advertising to promote its Products or as a part of a special promotional appearance for the Company, the NFLA-NC agrees, at the request of Company, to provide a good faith effort services of the officers or members of the NFLA for a reasonable amount of time as mutually agreed upon by all parties and at places reasonably convenient to each parties schedule. Each day shall not exceed a reasonable number of hours unless otherwise mutually agreed upon. The Company agrees that it will reimburse the NFLA-NC and if applicable the NFLA or its officers/members for all reasonable travel, lodging and meal expenses incurred by the NFLA / NFLA-NC or its officers/members in connection with such services. The Company understands that failure to use services of a member of the NFLA / NFLA-NC pursuant to this section shall not result in any reduction in payments to NFLA-NC under this Agreement. The obligations of the NFLA / NFLA-NC to provide services of its officers/members under this Agreement are subject to the condition that payments to NFLA-NC are current and up to date.
ollama_generated:
SECTION SIX. SERVICES OF NFLA-NC (Amended)

In the event that NFLA-NC elects to provide its services, or those of its officers and members, to Company for promotional purposes related to Company's Products or special promotional events, Company requests NFLA-NC, in a good faith effort, to make available its representatives for a mutually agreed duration, considering each party's schedule. The daily working hours shall not exceed what is considered reasonable, unless otherwise consented by all parties.

Company acknowledges and agrees that it will compensate NFLA-NC and, if applicable, the NFLA or its officers/members for any travel, lodging, and meal expenses incurred during the performance of these services. It is understood that Company's failure to utilize the services of an NFLA / NFLA-NC representative does not lead to a reduction in payments to NFLA-NC as outlined in this Agreement.

The obligation of NFLA / NFLA-NC to supply its representatives' services, as stipulated in this Agreement, is contingent upon the timely and up-to-date payment of fees to NFLA-NC by Company.

original: C. During the Contract Period, NFLA-NC shall make a good faith effort to assure that its members shall wear Company Products at all professional and promotional events and at all media appearances where appropriate, and when not in conflict with its members existing agreements. It is agreed that the logo or name of Company (the “Company Logo”) shall be affixed to an appropriate location (i.e. shoulder-sleeve and/or back] of all Company Products that members of the NFLA-NC wear. Company agrees that it will be responsible for, and the cost of, affixing the Company Logo on all such Company Products. Company acknowledges that other locations on the NFLA-NC Products are reserved for NFLA-NC’s other sponsors. Furthermore, Company understands that if the NFLA-NC or its Officers/members participate in a special team event where there is an official uniform, then representatives of the NFLA-NC are permitted to wear such uniform during such event.
ollama_generated: A. For the Term of this Agreement, NC-NFLA has the discretionary obligation to prioritize the use of Company Products at all professional and promotional events, as well as media appearances, provided that said use does not conflict with existing agreements of its members. The Company Logo shall be placed on an appropriate section (such as the shoulder-sleeve or back) of all NC-NFLA member's Company Products. The responsibility for affixing the Company Logo and associated costs falls on the NC-NFLA. It is acknowledged by the Company that other locations on the NC-NFLA Products are reserved for the association's other sponsors. Additionally, the Company understands that if the NC-NFLA or its officials participate in a special team event with an official uniform, members may wear this uniform during said event, subject to the rules and regulations set by the event organizers.

original: SECTION FIFTEEN. CONTRACT EXTENSION Due to long product development lead times, Company and NFLA-NC agree to begin discussions for the renewal of this Agreement by no later than June 1st, 2020. All terms of this Agreement will automatically commence on November 1st, 2017, and expire on November 2nd, 2020.
ollama_generated:
SECTION FIFTEEN. AUTOMATIC RENEWAL OF AGREEMENT
Upon the occurrence of product development delays, NFLA-NC and Company reserve the right to commence negotiations for the extension of this Agreement no sooner than June 1st, 2020. The original terms of this Agreement will persist from November 1st, 2017, until such a time that both parties reach an agreement on renewal terms; at which point, these new terms shall take effect and the Agreement shall continue indefinitely, with annual reviews for potential amendments. In the event that no agreement is reached by June 1st, 2020, this Agreement will automatically expire on November 2nd, 2020.

original: SECTION NINETEEN. ASSIGNMENT This Agreement shall bind and inure to the benefit of Company and NFLA and their respective successors and assigns.
modified:
SECTION NINETEEN - TRANSFER OF RIGHTS AND OBLIGATIONS
This Agreement will be exclusively applicable to the initial parties, Company and NFLA; any subsequent changes or alterations in ownership shall not be considered as assigns and will not be bound by this Agreement. However, the surviving or resulting legal entity(ies) or organization(s) that acquire(s) all or substantially all of the assets, rights, titles, interests, or business of either party hereto, whether directly or indirectly, shall succeed to the obligations and liabilities of the original party hereunder.

original: Source: GRIDIRON BIONUTRIENTS, INC., 8-K, 12/6/2017 SECTION TWENTY-TWO. NO JOINT VENTURE This Agreement does not constitute and shall not be construed as constituting an association, partnership, joint venture or relationship of principal and agent, or employer and employee, between NFLA and Company. Neither party shall have any right to obligate or bind the other party in any manner whatsoever except as expressly set forth in this Agreement, nothing contained in this Agreement shall give, or is intended to give, any rights of any kind to any person.
ollama_generated:
Clause:
Source: GRIDIRON BIONUTRIENTS, INC., 8-K, 12/6/2017 SECTION TWENTY-TWO. IMPLIED JOINT VENTURE Obligations arising from any implied association, partnership, joint venture, or similar relationship between NFLA and Company are explicitly excluded under this Agreement. Each party retains the right to act independently and is not authorized to obligate or bind the other party in any way except as expressly provided for in this Agreement. It is understood that no provisions of this Agreement shall be construed as granting, or intended to grant, any rights or obligations to any third party.
